Message.Issue: Define a custom attribute to replace 'ICA1040'.

Implement IDisposable on 'NoDisposeMethod' because it creates members of the following IDisposable types: 'FileStream'. If 'NoDisposeMethod' has previously shipped, adding new members that implement IDisposable to this type is considered a breaking change to existing consumers.
Because type 'SecurityRules' contains only 'static' ('Shared' in Visual Basic) members, add a default private constructor to prevent the compiler from adding a default public constructor.

Rule.Name: Avoid empty interfaces
Rule.Description: Interfaces are meant to contain members that specify a set of behaviors. To mark or label a class, use an attribute instead of an empty interface.
Rule.Resolution: Define a custom attribute to replace {0}.

Rule.Name: Static holder types should not have constructors
Rule.Description: Instances of types that define only static members do not need to be created. Many compilers will automatically add a public default constructor if no constructor is specified. To prevent this, adding an empty private constructor may be required.
Rule.Resolution: Because type {0} contains only 'static' ('Shared' in Visual Basic) members, add a default private constructor to prevent the compiler from adding a default public constructor.

Rule.Name: Types that own disposable fields should be disposable
Rule.Description: Types that declare disposable members should also implement IDisposable. If the type does not own any unmanaged resources, do not implement a finalizer on it.
Rule.Resolution: Implement IDisposable on {0} because it creates members of the following IDisposable types: {1}. If {0} has previously shipped, adding new members that implement IDisposable to this type is considered a breaking change to existing consumers.
